meanings.sent1: He enjoyed puffing on a stogy during poker night.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman savored the aroma of his stogy as he relaxed in his armchair.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone laughed when Grandpa pretended his stogy was a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The stogy was like a loyal companion, always by his side in times of contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The stogy's smoke curled gracefully in the air, leaving a lingering scent of nostalgia.

meanings.definition: A dull, old-fashioned person or thing.
meanings.sent1: She found the history lesson to be a real stogy, putting her to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The town council was filled with stogies who resisted any change.
meanings.sent3: The old clock in the hallway was such a stogy, always ticking at the same slow pace.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as outdated as a stogy in a world of e-cigarettes.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit felt like a collection of stogies, relics of a bygone era.
